com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api

Class WowzaGoCoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.WowzaGoCoder

  • public final class WowzaGoCoder
extends Object
    This class is used to initialize the GoCoder SDK and provide access to device and platform information.

    NOTE: Many of the original methods from this class have been deprecated. The recommended approach for SDK usage is detailed below.

    The init(Context, String) method must be called to validate the GoCoder SDK license key before any other calls are made to the SDK.

    The recommend approach for building apps with the GoCoder SDK is...

    1. Initialize the SDK using init(Context, String) as always
    2. Create an instance of WZBroadcastConfig to configure the broadcast stream
    3. To capture and stream from the active device camera, create an instance of WZCameraView in your application's layout resources or create one dynamically and configure the broadcast to use it via WZBroadcastConfig.setVideoBroadcaster(WZBroadcastAPI.VideoBroadcaster)
    4. To capture and stream audio from the standard audio input device, create an instance of WZAudioDevice and configure the broadcast to use it via WZBroadcastConfig.setAudioBroadcaster(WZBroadcastAPI.AudioBroadcaster)
    5. Create an instance of WZBroadcast to create and control a broadcast stream

    Visit GoCoder SDK for Android samples on GitHub to download the latest sample app code

      • init

        public static WowzaGoCoder init(Context context,
                                String apiLicenseKey)
        Initialize the GoCoder SDK

        If initialization fails, null is returned and getLastError() can be called to retrieve error information.

        Parameters:
        context - the current app Context
        apiLicenseKey - the GoCoder SDK API license key
        Returns:
        the static GoCoder SDK initializer through which you can retrieve platform information
